title: geologicAge
description: A name, code, or date describing an event or period in geologic time, expressed either as an absolute date calculated using a named dating method, or as a relative date that is drawn from stratigraphy or biostratigraphy.

ageTimeScale.description: Name of a recognized geologic time scale. This includes "Absolute" as the name of the time scale for measuring geologic dates before the present and names of geologic dating systems that are arrangements of symbols or names in order of relative geologic time

ageEstimate.description: Either an absolute geologic date or a relative geologic age name describing an event or period in geologic time based on the Geologic_Time_Scale.

ageUncertainty.description: The error estimate for the geologic time. This should include the units of measure, a description of what the error estimate represents and how it was calculated.

ageExplanation.description: The name and/or description of the method used to calculate the ageEstimate. Detailed information about the method may be provided through references contained in the ageReference.

ageReference.description: Citation for works providing detailed information about any element of the geologicAge.

title.description: Name by which the cited resource is known.

alternateTitle.description: Alias by which the cited resource is known.

date.description: Date referenced to the cited resource.

responsibleParty.description: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organization(s) associated with the cited resource.

presentationForm.description: The form that the resource is presented, such as: digital map, digital document, etc.

identifier.description: Identifier for the resource in the context of the citation.

otherCitationDetails.description: Other information required to complete the citation that is not recorded elsewhere.

onlineResource.description: On-line information related to the citation.

ISO 19115-2: CI_Citation > citedResponsibleParty > CI_ResponsibleParty > contact > CI_Contact > onlineResource > CI_OnlineResource

graphic.description: Online graphic associated with the citation

series.title: series
series.description: Information about the series, or aggregate resource, to which a resource belongs.

description.description: Supplemental information describing the date context.

role.description: Function performed by the contact in the current context.

roleExtent.description: The area or period of time for which the role is valid.

party.description: Identifies all the contacts associated with the role.

contactId.description: Identifier matching a contactId in the main contact array.

organizationMembers.description: Identifies individuals that have an association with an organization contact.

extent.json.description: Information about the geographic, vertical, and temporal extent of a resource.

verticalExtent.description: An array of objects each describing a vertical boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

temporalExtent.description: An array of objects each describing a temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

geographicExtent.json.description: Describes the spatial area of the resource

containsData.description: Idication of whether the geographic element encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data are not present.

boundingBox.description: General geographic position of the resource.

geographicElement.description: An array of objects each describing a geographic boundary or location comprising all or a portion of the resource.

description.description: Short description of the geographic areal domain of the data set. Examples include, "Manistee River watershed", "extent of 7 Â½ minute quads containing any property belonging to Yellowstone National Park", or "ponds and reservoirs larger than 2 acres in Jefferson County, Colorado".

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_GeographicDescription > geographicIdentifier > MD_Identifier > code

boundingBox.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

minimumAltitude.description: The minimum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

maximumAltitude.description: The maximum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

unitsOfAltitude.description: The units of measure in which altitude is expressed.

identifier.description: A name that is used to identify the resource.

namespace.description: A string which unambiguously defines the namespace for the identifier.

description.description: A natural language description of the meaning of the identifier value.

authority.description: Citation for the authority issuing the identifier.

geographicExtent.json_definitions_boundi.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

geojson.json.title: GeoJSON object
geojson.json.description:
GeoJSON is a format for encoding a variety of geographic data structures. A GeoJSON object may represent a geometry, a feature, or a collection of features. 

GeoJSON supports the following geometry types: Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString, MultiPolygon, and GeometryCollection. Features in GeoJSON contain a geometry object and additional properties, and a feature collection represents a list of features. 

 The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) [WGS84] datum, with longitude and latitude units    of decimal degrees.  This is equivalent to the coordinate reference    system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN    urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC::CRS84. 

See http://geojson.org for the full specification.

geometries.description: The set of geometry objects constituting the GeometryCollection.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers

feature.title: Feature
feature.description: A GeoJSON object with the type "Feature" is a feature object. A feature object has a geometry, properties, and an optional identifier.

geometry.description: The geometry object associated with the Feature.

oneOf.title: null geometry
oneOf.description: A feature object with no associated geometry. For example, a null value may be used when defining a bounding box only.

id.description: Unique identifier for the GeoJSON feature object.

featureCollection.title: FeatureCollection
featureCollection.description: A GeoJSON object comprised of multiple Feature objects.

features.description: Set of Features constituting the FeatureCollection.

featureProperties.title: FeatureProperties
featureProperties.description: JSON object containing information about a feature or collection.

oneOf.title: null
oneOf.description: A feature object with no identified properties.

ISO 19115-2: geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point, LineString, Polygon] > description

featureName.description: A title associated with a feature.

ISO 19115-2: geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point, LineString, Polygon] > name

featureScope.description: A word or phrase identifying the type of object described by the feature.

acquisitionMethod.description: Method used to establish the position of the geographic feature.

identifier.description: Identifier for the geographic element with optional cited authority.

bbox.json.description: A GeoJSON object MAY have a member named 'bbox' to include information on the coordinate range for its Geometries, Features, or FeatureCollections. The value of the bbox member MUST be an array of length 2 * n where n is the number of dimensions represented in the contained geometries, with all axes of the most southwesterly point followed by all axes of the more northeasterly point. The axes order of a bbox follows the axes order of geometries. The values of a 'bbox' array are[west, south, east, north].

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_GeographicBoundingBox, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > westBoundLongitude > Decimal {west}, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > eastBoundLongitude > Decimal {east}, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > southBoundLatitude > Decimal {south}, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > northBoundLatitude > Decimal {north}
FGDC CSDGM: [idinfo > spdom > bounding > westbc], [idinfo > spdom > bounding > eastbc], [idinfo > spdom > bounding > northbc], [idinfo > spdom > bounding > southbc]

geometry.json.title: geometry
geometry.json.description:
A geometry is a GeoJSON object where the type member's value is one of the following strings: "Point", "MultiPoint", "LineString", "MultiLineString", "Polygon", "MultiPolygon", or "GeometryCollection".

A GeoJSON geometry object of any type other than "GeometryCollection" must have a member with the name "coordinates". The value of the coordinates member is always an array. The structure for the elements in this array is determined by the type of geometry.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point | LineString | Polygon > [interior | exterior] | MultiGeometry]

coordinates.description: The position representing a point, represented by an array of numbers following x, y, z order (easting, northing, altitude for coordinates in a projected coordinate reference system, or longitude, latitude, altitude for coordinates in a geographic coordinate reference system).

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > Point > coordinates

oneOf.title: MultiPoint
oneOf.description: A geographic object comprised of multiple points.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Point[ ]

coordinates.description: The set of positions that constitute the MultiPoint geometry.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Point[ ] > coordinates

oneOf.title: LineString
oneOf.description: A geometry object comprised of a minimum of two positions.

coordinates.description: The set of positions that constitute the LineString geometry.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > LineString > coordinates

oneOf.title: MultiLineString
oneOf.description: A geometry object comprised of one or more LineStrings.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > LineString[ ]

coordinates.description: The set of LineString(s) that constitute the MultiLineString.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > LineString[ ] > coordinates

oneOf.title: Polygon
oneOf.description:
A geometry object that is composed of a set of LinearRings. A LinearRing is a closed LineString with 4 or more positions. The first and last positions are equivalent (they represent equivalent points).

For Polygons with multiple rings, the first must be the exterior ring and any others must be interior rings or holes.

oneOf.title: MultiPolygon
oneOf.description: A geometry object comprised of multiple polygons.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Polygon[ ]

coordinates.description: The set of Polygons that constitute the MultiPolygon.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Polygon[ ] > [exterior > LinearRing > coordinates | interior[ ] > LinearRing > coordinates]

position.title: position
position.description: A position is the fundamental geometry construct. A position is represented by an array of numbers following x, y, z order (easting, northing, altitude for coordinates in a projected coordinate reference system, or longitude, latitude, altitude for coordinates in a geographic coordinate reference system).

lineString.title: lineString
lineString.description: An array of two or more positions

allOf.title: minimum 2
allOf.description: The LineString must consist of two or more positions

linearRing.title: LinearRing
linearRing.description: An array of a minimum of four positions where the first equals the last

allOf.title: minimum 4
allOf.description: A LinearRing is a closed LineString with 4 or more positions.

polygon.title: Polygon
polygon.description: A set of LinearRings that constitute a Polygon geometry. For Polygons with multiple rings, the first must be the exterior ring and any others must be interior rings or holes.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > Polygon > [exterior > LinearRing > coordinates | interior[ ] > LinearRing > coordinates]

description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the verticalExtent.

maxValue.description: Highest vertical extent contained in the resource.

projection.json.title: projection
projection.json.description: The set of parameters for the projection that applies to the resource.

identifier.description: The identifier for the projection. Combine with a namespace to explicitly identify the projection. For example, code="albers" and namespace="org.adiwg.code.mapProjection".

description.description: A complete description of a grid system, not defined elsewhere in this standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the grid system, the names of the parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between the Earth and the coordinates of the grid system.

name.description: A descriptive name for the projection.

gridIdentifier.description: The identifier for the grid system.

identifier.description: The identifier for the grid system. Combine with a namespace to explicitly identify the grid system. For example, code="utm" and namespace="org.adiwg.code.mapGridSystem".

description.description: A complete description of a grid system, not defined elsewhere in this standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the grid system, the names of the parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between the Earth and the coordinates of the grid system.

name.description: A descriptive name for the grid system.

gridZone.description: The unique zone identifier for grid coordinate systems.

standardParallel1.description: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

standardParallel2.description: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

longitudeOfCentralMeridian.description: The line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

latitudeOfProjectionOrigin.description: The latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinates for a map projection.

falseEasting.description: The value added to all 'x' values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers.

falseNorthing.description: The value added to all 'y' values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers.

falseEastingNorthingUnits.description: The units of measure for falseEasting and falseNorthing.

scaleFactorAtEquator.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the equator.

heightOfProspectivePointAboveSurface.description: The height of viewpoint above the Earth, expressed in meters.

longitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: The longitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

latitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: The latitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

scaleFactorAtCenterLine.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the center line.

scaleFactorAtCentralMeridian.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the central meridian.

straightVerticalLongitudeFromPole.description: The longitude to be oriented straight up from the North or South Pole.

scaleFactorAtProjectionOrigin.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance at the projection origin.

azimuthAngle.description: The angle measured clockwise from north, and expressed in degrees.

landsatPath.description: The number of the orbit of the Landsat satellite.

obliqueLinePoint.description: The method used to describe the line along which an oblique Mercator map projection is centered using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line.

fixedToEarth.description: True if the z-axis of the coordinate system coincides with a plumb line through the origin that locally is aligned with the surface of the Earth.

verticalDatum.json.title: verticalDatum
verticalDatum.json.description: The reference frame or system from which vertical distances (altitudes or depths) are measured.

datumIdentifier.description: The identification given to the surface taken as the surface of reference from which altitudes or depths are measured.

encodingMethod.description: The means used to encode the altitudes.

isDepthSystem.description: True if depth system, false if altitude system.

verticalResolution.description: The minimum distance possible between two adjacent altitude or depth values, expressed in units of measure.

unitOfMeasure.description: The units of measure for altitude or depth measurements.

temporalExtent.json.description: A temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

timeInstant.description: Represents an identifiable position in time.

id.description: A unique identifier for the timeInstant.

description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the date and time.

timePeriod.json.description: A span of time represented by a starting date-time and an ending date-time.

description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the time period.

periodName.description: Names associated with the time period.

oneOf.title: dateTime

endDateTime.description: Ending date, or date and time.

oneOf.title: geologicAge
oneOf.description: A timePeriod with a startGeologicAge and/or endGeologicAge.

startGeologicAge.description: A name, code, or date for the beginning of an event or period in geologic time.

endGeologicAge.description: A name, code, or date for the end of an event or period in geologic time.

duration.description: Object for collecting information about a duration or period of time.

timeInterval.description: Defines a length of time in specific units.

units.description: The unit of time for the interval.

citation.json_definitions_series.description: Information about the series, or aggregate resource, to which a resource belongs.

onlineResource.json.description: Information about accessing online resources and services.

protocol.description: The connection protocol to be used such as: ftp, http, etc.

description.description: Detailed text description of what the online resource is/does.

function.description: Function performed by the online resource.

applicationProfile.description: Name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource.

protocolRequest.description: Request used to access the resource depending on the protocol, e.g. body of POST(http)_ request.

common.json_definitions_uri.description: Location (address) for on-line access using a Uniform Resource Identifier, usually in the form of a Uniform Resource Locator (URL).

graphic.json.title: graphic
graphic.json.description: Provides a path or link to images, maps, flow charts, models, etc. that illustrate the resource.

fileName.description: Name of the file that contains a graphic describing the resource.

fileType.description: The format in which the illustration is encoded such as GIF, JPEG, PBM, PS, TIFF.

fileConstraint.description: Identifies, legal, security, and other constraint requirements associated with use and distribution of the graphic

anyOf.title: security required if type is security
legal required if type is legal

useLimitation.description: Limitation affecting the fitness for use of the resource or metadata. For example, "not to be used for navigation".

scope.description: temporal extent and or level of the application of the constraint restrictions.

graphic.description: Graphic or symbol indicating the constraint

reference.description: Citation for the limitation or constraint

releasability.description: Information concerning the parties to who the resource can or cannot be released.

responsibleParty.description: Entity responsible for the resource constraint

legalConstraint.description: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.

accessConstraint.description: Access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource or metadata.

useConstraint.description: Constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations or warnings on using the resource or metadata.

otherConstraint.description: Other restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.

securityConstraint.description: Handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns.

classification.description: Name of the handling restrictions on the resource or metadata.

userNote.description: Explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource or metadata.

classificationSystem.description: Name of the classification system associated with a security constraint.

handlingDescription.description: Additional description regarding the security handling of the resource or metadata.

scopeCode.description: Class of information to which the resource applies.

scopeDescription.description: Detailed description/listing of the items specified by the scope.

scopeExtent.description: Information about the horizontal, vertical and temporal extent of the resource specified by the scope.

dataset.description: Dataset to which the information applies.

attributes.description: Instances of attribute types to which the information is applied.

features.description: Instances of feature types to which the information is applied.

other.description: Class of information that does not fall into the other categories to which the information applies.
